name: SetTargetDatabase
description: Set ReadyRoll target database name and login credentials
author: Redgate Software

inputs.name: ResourceGroupName
inputs.label: Azure Resource Group
inputs.helpMarkDown: Select the Azure Resource Group, which contains the Azure SQL Server instance, which in turn contains the Azure SQL Database you wish to deploy to.

inputs.name: AzureTargetServer
inputs.label: Target Azure SQL Server instance
inputs.helpMarkDown: The fully qualified Azure SQL Server instance name for the target database.

inputs.name: AzureTargetDatabase
inputs.label: Target Azure SQL Database name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the Azure SQL Database to deploy to.

inputs.name: TargetServer
inputs.label: Target SQL Server instance
inputs.helpMarkDown: The fully qualified SQL Server instance name for the target database.

inputs.name: TargetDatabase
inputs.label: Target database name
inputs.helpMarkDown: The name of the database to deploy to.

inputs.name: UseWindowsAuth
inputs.label: Use Windows Authentication
inputs.helpMarkDown: If you check this field, Windows Authentication will be used to connect, using the account that runs the agent. Otherwise, SQL Server Authentication will be used and you will need to specify a username and password below.

inputs.name: TargetUserName
inputs.label: Target username
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SQL Server username used to connect to the database.

inputs.name: TargetPassword
inputs.label: Target password (add in the Variables tab)
inputs.helpMarkDown: The SQL Server password used to connect to the database. If you want to make this secret, add the TargetPassword variable in the Variables tab, and then click its padlock to make it secret.

inputs.name: ShadowServerOption
inputs.label: Shadow server

options.variables: Use custom server (set in the Variables tab)

inputs.helpMarkDown:
SQL Server instance where the shadow database will be deployed. 

 ### If 'custom server' is selected 
 Add the following variable in the Variables tab: 
 * ShadowServer 

 Also, if you want to use SQL Server Authentication, then add the additional following variables in the Variables tab: 
 * ShadowUserName 
 * ShadowPassword
